page.title: 11 Quaker's End
page.content: The White House was originally called Quaker's End and is probably the oldest house in Holywell Row. The present owner and her daughter bought the house 18 years ago when they moved from Dublin, Ireland. The site dates back 500 years and the front wall of the house is the original one that was built 300 years ago. In the lounge the fireplace is very old and is made of some of the original bricks. There are beamed ceilings throughout the house and all the windows are leaded. The entrance to the house has been made from the original stable doors. There is an old barn behind the house which also dates back 500 years. Both buildings have been re-roofed and the original thatch removed. An old picture of the house as it appeared long ago, is kept in the Methodist Chapel.
